Title: Judge rejects Apple bid for injunction against Amazon,Judge rejects Apple bid for injunction against Amazon
Body: SAN FRANCISCO A U.S. judge denied Apple Inc's attempt to quickly stop online retailer Amazon.com Inc from using the "App Store" name, according to a court document., SAN FRANCISCO, July 6 A U.S. judge denied AppleInc's  attempt to quickly stop online retailerAmazon.com Inc  from using the "App Store" name,according to a court document.

Title: EBay sales strong in June: report,EBay sales strong in June -- ChannelAdvisor,Target to sell new electronic reader,Target to sell new electronic reader,PRESS DIGEST - British business - July 11
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Retailers generated strong sales growth through eBay Inc  Inc in June, e-commerce software company ChannelAdvisor said on Monday., SAN FRANCISCO, July 11 Retailers generatedstrong sales growth through eBay Inc  Inc in June,e-commerce software company ChannelAdvisor said on Monday.,SAN FRANCISCO Target Corp will soon start selling a new electronic reader that competes with Amazon.com Inc's Kindle and Barnes & Noble's Nook.,   * Device to be fully integrated with Google eBooks platform, BABY-BOOMERS BILL WILL SEND DEBT SPIRALLING, SAYS OBR

Title: Netflix raises DVD, streaming plan price by 60 percent,UPDATE 1-Netflix raises DVD, streaming plan price by 60 pct,UPDATE 1-Groupon targets bigger items with car offer,Surge in California tax measures seen for 2012,Dealtalk: Barnes & Noble won't get better bid than Malone's,DEALTALK-Barnes & Noble won't get better bid than Malone's,Groupon offers first car deal, targets bigger items,Groupon offers 1st car deal, targets bigger items,Amazon seeks ballot measure to undo California tax,Amazon seeks ballot measure to undo California tax
Body: LOS ANGELES Netflix Inc hiked monthly prices for customers who use both its mail and online services, a move that could steer users toward its growing Internet streaming service., * Shares up slightly (Adds company, analyst comment; adds shares), * Applying Groupon model to cars a bit problematic -analyst, * Measures for income tax hike, against online sales tax,NEW YORK/PHILADELPHIA Nearly a year after Barnes & Noble Inc  put itself up for sale, the largest U.S. bookstore chain likely will settle for the only firm offer it has received: $1 billion from John Malone's Liberty Media Corp ., NEW YORK/PHILADELPHIA, July 12 Nearly a yearafter Barnes & Noble Inc  put itself up for sale, thelargest U.S. bookstore chain likely will settle for the onlyfirm offer it has received: $1 billion from John Malone'sLiberty Media Corp .,SAN FRANCISCO Groupon Inc offered its first car coupon on Tuesday, a sign the largest online daily deal company is expanding into bigger-ticket items.,* Applying Groupon model to cars a bit problematic -analyst,SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc has taken the first step toward asking California voters to repeal a new law requiring websites that forward shoppers to it to collect sales tax, a spokeswoman for the state's attorney general said on Monday., SAN FRANCISCO, July 11 Amazon.com Inc has taken the first step toward asking California voters torepeal a new law requiring websites that forward shoppers to itto collect sales tax, a spokeswoman for the state's attorneygeneral said on Monday.

Title: Apple stock looks cheap ahead of results,PREVIEW-Apple stock looks cheap ahead of results,Decision soon for California's 'Amazon tax' measure
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc  should deliver yet another bumper quarter, but some investors are holding out for a monstrous second half when the new iPhone hits and a new online content service takes wing., * Market awaits new iPhone, iPad supply crunch seen easing, SAN FRANCISCO, July 15 Amazon.com Inc ,the world's largest on-line retailer, will learn by Monday if aproposed measure to roll back a new California law taxing salesover the Internet moves on to its next step in seeking a placeon the state's ballot.

Title: Borders demise seen a small help to Barnes & Noble,Frustrated judge pushes Google digital book deal,Frustrated judge pushes Google digital book deal,Borders demise seen a small help to Barnes & Noble,Borders, unable to find white knight, to liquidate,Factbox: A history of Borders Group Inc,FACTBOX-A history of Borders Group Inc,UPDATE 5-Borders, unable to find white knight, to liquidate
Body: NEW YORK Bookstore chain Barnes & Noble Inc  will eventually feel a modest boost from the liquidation of its largest rival, Borders Group Inc, but still faces stiff competition and an industrywide decline in book sales, Wall Street analysts said.,NEW YORK A Manhattan federal judge set a September 15 deadline for Google Inc, authors and publishers to come up with a legal plan to create the world's largest digital library, expressing frustration that the six-year-old dispute has not been resolved., * Judge says imposing deadline could help speed resolution,   * Borders liquidation to help B&N sales longer-term,NEW YORK Borders Group Inc, the second-largest U.S. bookstore chain, said it has canceled an upcoming bankruptcy auction and will close its doors for good.,NEW YORK Borders Group Inc said on Monday it would liquidate after being unable to find a white knight willing to keep it alive as a going concern., NEW YORK, July 19 Borders Group Inc said on Monday it would liquidate after being unable to find awhite knight willing to keep it alive as a going concern.[ID:nN1E76H1LQ], * Process will close 400 stores, cost 11,000 jobs (Adds quote from Najafi in paragraphs 7,8)

Title: Amazon's next billion-dollar business eyed,Amazon's next billion-dollar business eyed,CORRECTED - RPT-PREVIEW-Amazon's next billion-dollar business eyed,CORRECTED - PREVIEW-Amazon's next billion-dollar business eyed,Spartoo hires Jefferies to help raise cash,Amazon's next billion-dollar business eyed
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc's cloud computing unit may be its next billion-dollar business and analysts will be watching for clues on how fast this secretive unit is growing when the Internet retailer reports results next week.,SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com  Inc's cloud computing unit may be its next billion-dollar business and analysts will be watching for clues on how fast this secretive unit is growing when the Internet retailer reports results next week., (In July 21 story, deletes word "extra" when referring tocomputing power in paragraphs 2 and 7), (In July 21 story, deletes word "extra" when referring tocomputing power in paragraphs 2 and 7), PARIS/LONDON, July 22 Spartoo, a French onlineshoe retailer, has hired investment bank Jefferies to help itraise 100 million euros from a new investor as it seeks toexpand, sources familiar with the situation said.,SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com  Inc's cloud computing unit may be its next billion-dollar business and analysts will be watching for clues on how fast this secretive unit is growing when the Internet retailer reports results next week.

Title: Exclusive: Google offers credit card to advertisers,Amazon adds streaming video from CBS,UPDATE 3-Amazon adds streaming video from CBS,UPDATE 1-Freescale Q2 profit beats Street view,Analysis: Groupon growth lures rivals and regulators,Samsung takes shot at iPad with new Galaxy Tab,UPDATE 3-Samsung takes shot at iPad with new Galaxy Tab
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc is introducing a credit card for its advertising customers, offering its clients a credit line to try and drum up business as competition in the online ad market heats up.,SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc has licensed thousands of television shows from CBS Corp to help the largest Internet retailer compete with DVD rental and video streaming company Netflix Inc., * Deal adds about 2,000 videos to Amazon Prime service (Adds details on Netflix streaming; updates shares), July 20 Freescale Semiconductor , whichdebuted late May on the New York Stock Exchange, postedsecond-quarter profit ahead of market estimates, helped by asurge in demand for its radio frequency, analog and sensorchips.,SAN FRANCISCO Groupon Inc's rapid growth has attracted rivals and regulators, a twin threat to the largest online daily deal company as it gets ready for an initial public offering.,SEOUL South Korea's Samsung Electronics Co launched a thinner and lighter version of its Galaxy tablet in its lucrative home market, trying to chip into blockbuster sales of Apple Inc's iPad. |Â , * Worldwide tablet market set to surge to 70 mln this year

Title: Borders liquidation approved by bankruptcy judge,UPDATE 2-Borders liquidation approved by bankruptcy judge,Borders liquidation approved by bankruptcy judge,UPDATE 4-AT&T profit, subscriber growth beat expectations,Exclusive: Google offers credit card to advertisers,Analysis: Apple guns for Exxon as king of stocks,Back-to-school spending to dip slightly-NRF survey,Borders to seek court's OK on plan to shut doors
Body: NEW YORK Borders Group Inc , won bankruptcy court approval on Thursday to liquidate its 40-year-old business, effectively spelling the end for the second-largest U.S. book retailer., * Hilco, Gordon Bros to take lead on liquidations (Updates with analysis, detail of potential Books-A-Milliondeal),NEW YORK Borders Group Inc , won bankruptcy court approval on Thursday to liquidate its 40-year-old business, effectively spelling the end for the second-largest U.S. book retailer., * Shares up slightly in morning trade (Adds analyst comment, connected device sales, share price),SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc is introducing a credit card for its advertising customers, offering its clients a credit line to try and drum up business as competition in the online ad market heats up.,SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc is within sight of catching up with Exxon Mobil as the most valuable company in the world., NEW YORK, July 21 U.S. shoppers plan to pullback a bit on their spending this back-to-school season, asurvey showed on Thursday, the latest sign that the secondbiggest selling season is not likely to be a boon forretailers., NEW YORK, July 21 Borders Group Inc is set to seek court approval on Thursday for the effective endof its 40-year-old business by hiring liquidators to conductclosing sales at its nearly 400 stores.

Title: Amazon tablet seen aiming to widen e-commerce lead,UPDATE 3-Amazon tablet seen aiming to widen e-commerce lead,Union grocers stuck in California pressure cooker,Union grocers stuck in California pressure cooker,UPDATE 1-Amazon to offer cheaper Kindle, sponsored by AT&T,JP Morgan upbeat on internet companies
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc will launch a tablet computer this year to extend its position as the world's largest Internet retailer, expand in mobile commerce and sell more digital goods, according to analysts and investors., * Tablet to be released by October, to run on Android -WSJ,LOS ANGELES A high-stakes supermarket labor dispute in southern California, the nation's toughest and most trend-setting food retail market, is exposing the challenges facing the grocery business and its union workers., * Southern California most competitive U.S. grocery market, NEW YORK, July 13 Amazon.com Inc  saidon Wednesday it has struck a sponsorship deal with AT&T Inc to sell a less expensive version of its Kindle 3G digitalreader.,Bangalore U.S. Internet companies will see double-digit growth in online advertising and e-commerce segments in coming years, helped by a surge in online accessibility through mobile devices and tablets, JP Morgan said, and initiated five major Internet stocks including Netflix , Google  and Amazon .

Title: Astronauts pack up for last shuttle ride home,UPDATE 1-Astronauts pack up for last shuttle ride home,Astronauts pack up for last shuttle ride home
Body: HOUSTON The shuttle Atlantis astronauts finished packing more than 2 tonnes of old equipment and trash from the International Space Station into a cargo hauler on Sunday for the last shuttle ride back to Earth. |Â , * Landing set for 5:57 a.m. EDT Thursday in Florida (Updates with details of cargo transfer, adds quote frombriefing), HOUSTON, July 17 The shuttle Atlantisastronauts finished packing more 2 tons of old equipment andtrash from the International Space Station into a cargo hauleron Sunday for the last shuttle ride back to Earth.

Title: Amazon revenue surges, stock jumps,UPDATE 4-Amazon revenue surges, stock jumps,Instant view: Amazon results beat Street, margins wane,US STOCKS-Futures up after Ford results, eyes on debt talks,Walmart puts Vudu on its main site to drive use,Walmart puts Vudu on its main site to drive use,PRESS DIGEST - Financial Times - July 26
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc reported a surge in quarterly revenue on sales of its kindle electronic reader and other electronics and forecast far better-than-expected revenue for the current quarter, sending its shares up more than 6 percent., * Shares up 6.3 percent in after-hours trading (Adds analyst comment, business background),LOS ANGELES Amazon.com Inc reported a dip in earnings but its revenue forecast raced past Wall Street's expectations, propelling its shares higher in after-hours trade., * Case-Shiller, consumer confidence, new home sales due,CHICAGO Wal-Mart Stores Inc is moving its Vudu video streaming and rental service to a place where it can get attract more eyeballs -- the Walmart.com web site -- as the growing service competes for attention with a variety of video services., * Vudu prices movie rentals from $1-$6.99; no contracts, News Corp shareholder Prince Alwaleed bin Talal hasrebuffed calls to change the company's dual-class sharestructure or leadership in the wake of the phone-hacking affair.http://www.ft.com/cms/s/0/101b1844-b60d-11e0-8bed-00144feabdc0.html#axzz1T3bCNK00

Title: Borders, unable to find white knight, to liquidate,UPDATE 4-Borders, unable to find white knight, to liquidate,Decision soon for California's "Amazon tax" measure,CORRECTED - US shuttle prepares to depart station for last time,Books-A-Million in talks on Borders stores: sources,Factbox: A history of Borders Group,FACTBOX-A history of Borders Group,Books-A-Million in talks on Borders stores-sources,Space shuttle prepares to depart station for last time,Mobile devices to lead consumer electronics growth: report
Body: NEW YORK Borders Group Inc, the second-largest U.S. bookstore chain, said it has canceled an upcoming bankruptcy auction and will close its doors for good., * Process will close 400 stores, cost 11,000 jobs (Adds detail on liquidation process),SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc , the world's largest on-line retailer, will learn by Monday if a proposed measure to roll back a new California law taxing sales over the Internet moves on to its next step in seeking a place on the state's ballot., (Corrects to read "134 previous shuttle missions," not 98, in10th paragraph),NEW YORK Borders Group Inc  has entered talks to sell a small number of stores to retailer Books-A-Million Inc  while hundreds of its other locations could be liquidated, according to two sources close to Borders' bankruptcy process.,NEW YORK An auction in bankruptcy court for Borders Group Inc  is scheduled to take place in Manhattan on Tuesday. A group of liquidators has been made the "stalking horse," and sources told Reuters no other bids have been made for the company in its entirety., NEW YORK, July 18 An auction in bankruptcy court for BordersGroup Inc  is scheduled to take place in Manhattan on Tuesday. Agroup of liquidators has been made the "stalking horse," and sources toldReuters no other bids have been made for the company in its entirety.[ID:nN1E76H0U3], * Books-A-Million in talks for less than 50 stores-sources,HOUSTON The crew of NASA's final space shuttle mission closed the hatch to the International Space Station for the final time on Monday in preparation for the shuttle's last flight back to Earth. |Â ,NEW YORK More customers than ever will buy tablet computers and smartphones this year, driving consumer electronics revenue to a record high of $190 billion in 2011, according to a new forecast from a leading industry trade group.

Title: LivingSocial enters Korea with biggest acquisition,UPDATE 2-LivingSocial enters Korea with biggest acquisition
Body: SEOUL LivingSocial agreed to buy South Korean online daily deal provider TicketMonster in a stock-swap to expand further into the Asian market, the companies said on Tuesday, without disclosing the value of the deal., * Acquisition is LivingSocial's ninth in past year (Adds background on acquisition, IPO, quotes)

Title: Senator supports online sales tax reform,U.S. senator supports online sales tax reform
Body: WASHINGTON Cash-strapped states seeking to collect billions in taxes from online transactions gained an ally in Washington on Friday when a senator introduced a bill for a federal solution to the problem., WASHINGTON, July 29 Cash-strapped statesseeking to collect billions in taxes from online transactionsgained an ally in Washington on Friday when a U.S. senatorintroduced a bill for a federal solution to the problem.

Title: How to play it: Amazon stock stoked on earnings,Amazon revenue and spending surges,Toys R Us to carry Kindle,Toys R Us to carry Kindle; OfficeMax to carry Nook,Analysts up Amazon price targets after strong rev view,US STOCKS-Wall St falls for 3rd day on debt ceiling worries,US STOCKS-Wall Street set to open lower on debt deadlock,RPT-UPDATE 5-Amazon revenue, spending surges; stock jumps,US STOCKS-Futures dip as debt stalemate curbs risk appetite,US STOCKS-Futures down as debt stalemate curbs risk appetite
Body: NEW YORK Amazon became the latest Internet company to post stellar earnings this week, after the Internet retailer recorded a 51 percent pop in second-quarter sales.,SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc will use its surging revenue to boost growth and drive expansion into areas such as Web content and cloud computing rather than boost its margins.,NEW YORK Toys R Us, the world's largest toy retailer, said its U.S. stores will carry Amazon.com's Kindle electronic reader and related accessories starting July 31., NEW YORK, July 27 Toys R Us, the world'slargest toy retailer, said its U.S. stores will carryAmazon.com's  Kindle electronic reader and relatedaccessories starting July 31.,Amazon.com Inc's higher-than-expected revenue forecast for the current quarter prompted at least five analysts to raise their target price on the stock, even as indications remain that there will be no let up in spending., * Indexes down: Dow 1 pct, S&P 1.4 pct, Nasdaq 2 pct, * Futures off: S&P 4.4 pts, Dow 16 pts, Nasdaq 12.75 pts, * Shares up 6.1 percent in after-hours trading (Rewrites first paragraph, adds details on spending, profitmargins), * Futures off: S&P 2.9 pts, Dow 7 pts, Nasdaq 6.5 pts, * Financials eyed after Goldman downgrades European banks

Title: Amazon flies high, may rise 25 percent more: Barron's,Amazon flies high, may rise 25 pct more-Barron's
Body: NEW YORK Amazon.com Inc shares, just below their all-time high, could rise 10 percent to 25 percent if its capital spending translates to fast growth in its retailing, Kindle e-readers and cloud-computing businesses, Barron's said in its August 1 edition., * Stock could rise 10-25 pct, hit record high on July 27

Title: Borders landlords wary of lease sale plan,Borders landlords wary of lease sale plan
Body: NEW YORK Borders Group Inc's  plan to auction its leases as it liquidates its bookstores is meeting opposition from landlords, who say the plan does not protect their interests., NEW YORK, Aug 4 Borders Group Inc's plan to auction its leases as it liquidates its bookstores ismeeting opposition from landlords, who say the plan does notprotect their interests.

Title: Google+, Apple's iCloud keep developers keen,Google+, Apple's iCloud keep developers interested
Body: TORONTO Mobile developers more than ever want to devote their energies to writing apps for Apple's iOS and Google's Android platforms at the expense of their less popular rivals, a study released on Wednesday showed., TORONTO, Aug 3 Mobile developers more than everwant to devote their energies to writing apps for Apple's iOSand Google's Android platforms at the expense of their lesspopular rivals, a study released on Wednesday showed.

Title: Baseball bats, police batons online sales boom in UK,Baseball bats, police batons online sales boom in UK
Body: LONDON Sales of baseball bats and batons have shot up more than 5,000 percent in the last 24 hours on Amazon's British website, as London suffered its worst violent unrest in decades., LONDON, Aug 9 Sales of baseball bats and batonshave shot up more than 5,000 percent in the last 24 hours onAmazon's British website, as London suffered its worstviolent unrest in decades.

Title: Borders wins court OK to auction name, leases,Borders wins court OK to auction name, leases,Wal-Mart's Vudu launches on iPad without an app,Wal-Mart's Vudu launches on iPad without an app
Body: NEW YORK A bankruptcy judge authorized Borders Group Inc on Wednesday to auction its name and real estate assets, the latest step in the liquidation of the nation's second-largest bookseller., * Judge approves bidding schedule over landlord opposition,SAN FRANCISCO Wal-Mart Stores Inc's Vudu video-streaming service launches on Apple Inc's iPad on Wednesday, but it doesn't come with the type of app that's common on the best-selling tablet computer., SAN FRANCISCO, Aug 9 Wal-Mart Stores Inc's Vudu video-streaming service launches on Apple Inc's iPad on Wednesday, but it doesn't come with the typeof app that's common on the best-selling tablet computer.

Title: Liberty mulls Barnes & Noble options: source,PRESS DIGEST - Wall Street Journal - Aug 17,PRESS DIGEST - New York Times business news - Aug 17
Body: NEW YORK John Malone's Liberty Media Corp , which in May offered to buy Barnes & Noble Inc, , is exploring additional options, including making only a small investment in the U.S. book store chain rather than buying it outright, a source familiar with the matter said., Aug 17 The following were the top stories in TheWall Street Journal on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified thesestories and does not vouch for their accuracy., Aug 17 The following were the top stories on TheNew York Times business pages on Wednesday. Title: Liberty takes stake in, but doesn't buy Barnes & Noble
Body: CHICAGO Barnes & Noble Inc  on Thursday said that John Malone's Liberty Media   invested $204 million in the bookseller, but discussions for Liberty to buy the company have ended.

Title: Cloud firm Box.net seeks $35 million in new funding,Cloud firm Box.net seeks $35 mln in new funding
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Cloud-storage and file-sharing company Box.net is raising $35 million in new funding, underscoring again the appeal of one of Silicon Valley's hottest investment areas., * Cloud company has already raised $18.7 million of total

Title: MP3tunes wins end to part of EMI copyright case,Hulu bids due Wednesday, wide range seen - WSJ
Body: * MP3tunes said to infringe copyrights on downloaded works, PHILADELPHIA, Aug 21 Initial takeoverbids for video service Hulu LLC are due on Wednesday andoffers could range from about $500 million to $2 billion, TheWall Street Journal reported on Sunday.

Title: Toys R Us puts baby gear near toys in more stores,European stores slash prices for defunct HP tablet,MP3tunes wins end to part of EMI copyright case,UPDATE 1-MP3tunes wins end to part of EMI copyright case
Body: NEW YORK, Aug 23 Toys "R" Us [TOY.UL] isopening 21 new stores this year that will sell toysside-by-side with products such as baby food and laundrysupplies, the world's largest toy retailer said on Tuesday., LONDON/FRANKFURT, Aug 23 European retailersslashed prices for Hewlett-Packard's TouchPad computerson Monday and Tuesday after just seven weeks on the shelves, inthe wake of the U.S. company's announcement that it would killoff the tablet.,NEW YORK A federal judge on Monday narrowed a lawsuit by EMI Group Ltd and 14 record companies and music publishers that accused MP3tunes LLC of letting users copy their songs without permission., * MP3tunes said to infringe copyrights on downloaded works

Title: Pandora Media revenue beats on strong ad sales,UPDATE 3-Pandora Media revenue beats on strong ad sales,Amazon launches local deals site for New York,UPDATE 1-Amazon launches local deals site for New York,Hulu seen drawing bids from Yahoo, others: sources,SK Telecom says no plan to bid for Hulu
Body: NEW YORK Online radio service Pandora Media Inc reported results that beat expectations on strong advertising sales in its fiscal second quarter., * Adj EPS 2 cents vs loss of 3 cents per share St. view,NEW YORK Amazon.com Inc said on Thursday it has launched a local deals site in New York in its latest effort to compete with Groupon Inc., NEW YORK, Aug 25 Amazon.com Inc  saidon Thursday it has launched a local deals site in New York inits latest effort to compete with Groupon Inc.,NEW YORK The deadline for initial bids in the auction for Hulu was extended from Wednesday until the end of the week to allow interested parties more time to examine the online video site's financial information, according to people familiar with the situation., SEOUL, Aug 25 South Korea's top mobile carrier,SK Telecom , said on Thursday that it had no plans tobid for U.S. online video site Hulu.

Title: $25 billion Groupon valuation "very high": analyst,$25 bln Groupon valuation 'very high' -analyst
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Estimates that Groupon Inc is worth $25 billion are very high because the largest online daily deals company is losing money, Benchmark Co analyst Fred Moran said on Friday., SAN FRANCISCO, Aug 12 Estimates that GrouponInc is worth $25 billion are very high because the largestonline daily deals company is losing money, Benchmark Coanalyst Fred Moran said on Friday.

Title: eBay pins China hopes
Body: HONG KONG eBay Inc expects sales from large exporters in China to maintain growth at 30-40 percent annually, with the e-commerce giant seeking acquisition opportunities as part of efforts to expand its footprint in the fast-growing market.

Title: Amazon may sell 3-5 million tablets in Q4: Forrester,UPDATE 1-Amazon may sell 3-5 mln tablets in Q4 -Forrester,Amazon may sell 3-5 mln tablets in Q4-Forrester,UPDATE 1-Nordstrom offers free shipping to lift online sales
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc may sell as many as 5 million tablet computers in the fourth quarter, making the largest Internet retailer the top competitor to Apple Inc in this fast-growing niche of the consumer PC market, Forrester Research said on Monday., * New tablet may lure more developers to Android (Adds Venture Capitalist comments), SAN FRANCISCO, Aug 29 Amazon.com Inc may sell as many as five million tablet computers in the fourthquarter, making the largest Internet retailer the topcompetitor to Apple Inc  in this fast-growing niche ofthe consumer PC market, Forrester Research said on Monday., NEW YORK, Aug 29 Nordstrom Inc  isoffering free shipping on orders placed on its websiteregardless of size in a move to lift online sales.

Title: Amazon offers California jobs if it drops tax,Amazon offers California jobs if it drops tax,Borders sues Next Jump over use of customer data,Borders sues Next Jump over use of customer data,Milner, Conway back ex-Google China chief's tech fund,BUY OR SELL-Digital River: mobile shift stirs undertow,Milner, Conway back Google ex-China chief's $180 mln tech fund
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc has proposed a hiring spree of 7,000 jobs in California if state leaders put a recently enacted online sales tax on hold for two years., * Lawmakers also aim to block Amazon's referendum effort,NEW YORK Bankrupt bookseller Borders Group Inc  has sued Next Jump Inc, accusing the website operator of attempting to steal its customers., NEW YORK, Sept 1 Bankrupt bookseller BordersGroup Inc  has sued Next Jump Inc, accusing thewebsite operator of attempting to steal its customers.,HONG KONG Innovation Works, founded by former Google  China head Kai-Fu Lee, said Facebook investor Yuri Milner and American angel investor Ron Conway are among financial backers of its Internet fund that has just raised $180 million to help young Chinese grow their startup firms., * Outlook trimmed on weak shareware; other businesses strong, HONG KONG, Sept 1 Innovation Works, founded byformer Google China head Kai-Fu Lee, said Facebookinvestor Yuri Milner and American angel investor Ron Conway areamong financial backers of its Internet fund that has justraised $180 million to help young Chinese grow their start-upfirms.

Body: NEW YORK A Borders Group Inc unit failed to give its workers proper notice of mass layoffs when it announced plan to liquidate in July, a new lawsuit alleges., NEW YORK, Sept 2 A Borders Group Inc unit failed to give its workers proper notice of mass layoffswhen it announced plan to liquidate in July, a new lawsuitalleges.,LOS ANGELES Amazon.com Inc plans to unveil a cheaper, smaller $250 rival to Apple Inc's iPad tablet device in November, industry blog TechCrunch reported on Friday., LOS ANGELES, Sept 2 Amazon.com Inc plans to unveil a cheaper, smaller $250 rival to Apple Inc's iPad tablet device in November, industry blogTechCrunch reported on Friday.,   * Agrees after Borders sought temporary restraining order,NEW YORK Marketing engine Next Jump Inc agreed to stop emailing Borders Group Inc's customers while the parties hash out how to move forward in trademark infringement litigation, a lawyer for Borders said on Friday.

Title: Amazon reworks website before offering new tablet,UPDATE 1-Amazon reworks website before offering new tablet,Amazon reworks website before new tablet: reports,Upstart gets jump on Amazon in India's nascent e-shopping market,FEATURE-Upstart gets jump on Amazon in India's nascent e-shopping market
Body: NEW YORK Amazon.com Inc is rolling out a major redesign of its familiar website as it prepares to offer a new $250 tablet device to rival Apple Inc's iPad., * Online store better displays digital wares: tech blogger, * Online store better displays digital wares: tech blogger,BANGALORE On some days when they were starting out, the Bansals would get on a motorbike to make the rounds of book warehouses around Bangalore, ride back to their two-bedroom apartment and package up orders for online customers., BANGALORE, Sept 4 On some days when they werestarting out, the Bansals would get on a motorbike to make therounds of book warehouses around Bangalore, ride back to theirtwo-bedroom apartment and package up orders for onlinecustomers.

Title: Amazon sales tax deal in California may help rivals,UPDATE 1-Amazon sales tax deal in Calif. may help rivals,Amazon sales tax deal in California may help rivals,Amazon sales tax deal in Calif. may help rivals,California may give Amazon year-long tax reprieve,California may give Amazon year-long tax reprieve,DirecTV streams NFL games for added sales,DirecTV streams NFL games for added sales,Ozon.ru wins biggest Russian e-commerce investment,Amazon in deal with legislators over tax law - LA Times
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc's agreement to start collecting sales tax in California next year may help brick and mortar rivals compete on prices with the world's largest Internet retailer., * Online price advantage may shrink (Adds comments from National Retail Federation),SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc's agreement to start collecting sales tax in California next year may help brick and mortar rivals compete better on price with the world's largest Internet retailer., SAN FRANCISCO, Sept 8 Amazon.com Inc's agreement to start collecting sales tax in California next yearmay help brick and mortar rivals compete better on price withthe world's largest Internet retailer.,SAN FRANCISCO California lawmakers rushed to write a bill to give Amazon.com Inc a one-year reprieve from collecting certain sales taxes in exchange for dropping its ballot measure campaign to undo the tax, aides said on Thursday., SAN FRANCISCO, Sept 8 California lawmakersrushed to write a bill to give Amazon.com Inc  aone-year reprieve from collecting certain sales taxes inexchange for dropping its ballot measure campaign to undo thetax, aides said on Thursday.,NEW YORK DirecTV is expanding its NFL Sunday Ticket television package, which lets viewers watch football outside their local markets, to see if it can make some extra money from broadcasting the games on the Internet., * Streaming-only NFL option could be new revenue source, LONDON, Sept 8 Russia's leading online retailerOzon.ru has secured funding of $100 million, the biggest privateinvestment to date in Russia's e-commerce market, from aconsortium including Japanese online retailer Rakuten ., Sept 8 Amazon.com Inc is in a deal withlegislators to avoid a ballot battle over the state's insistencethat the online retailer collect state sales tax on purchases byCalifornians, the LA Times said.

Body: SAN FRANCISCO EBay Inc hired former Thomson Reuters Corp executive Devin Wenig as president of its global marketplaces unit, the online commerce and auction site's largest division., * Wenig brings merger integration experience (Adds context on importance of Wenig's new position),NEW YORK Next Jump Inc has agreed not to contact Borders Group Inc's  customers or operate its website, resolving Borders' bid for an injunction over trademark infringement allegations against the marketing engine., * Accused by Borders of using website to steal customers (Adds that Next Jump will purge Borders' customer list infifth graph), * Accused by Borders of using website to steal customers,SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc is stepping up social media efforts after the largest Internet retailer partially missed one of the hottest technology trends of recent years.,* Internet retailer hires Yurcisin as director of social media * Amazon building Social Games Group fast * Late to the social media field, trails Facebook, Zynga

Title: Amazon's Selipsky bullish on AWS profitability,Amazon's Selipsky bullish on AWS profitability,Best Buy unveils new third-party Marketplace,UPDATE 1-Best Buy unveils new third-party Marketplace,Best Buy unveils new third-party marketplace,EBay hires ex-Thomson Reuters executive Wenig
Body: SEATTLE Ever since Amazon Web Services emerged as the next big thing for e-commerce giant Amazon.com Inc a few years ago, Wall Street has debated whether the business mints money or just breaks even., SEATTLE, Sept 7 Ever since Amazon Web Servicesemerged as the next big thing for e-commerce giant Amazon.comInc  a few years ago, Wall Street has debated whetherthe business mints money or just breaks even.,SAN FRANCISCO Best Buy Co said on Wednesday it will offer products online from other sellers through a new third-party Marketplace as the electronics retailer tries to better compete with Internet rivals Amazon.com and eBay Inc., * Buy.com among six third-party sellers signed up (Adds details of third-party sellers, share price, execcomment), SAN FRANCISCO, Sept 7 Best Buy Co  saidon Wednesday it will offer products online from other sellersthrough a new third-party Marketplace as the electronicsretailer tries to better compete with online rivals Amazon.com and eBay Inc .,SAN FRANCISCO EBay Inc hired former Thomson Reuters Corp executive Devin Wenig as president of its global marketplaces unit, the online commerce and auction site's largest division.

Title: Amazon in talks to launch digital book library: WSJ,Amazon in talks to launch digital book library -WSJ
Body: NEW YORK Amazon.com Inc is in talks with book publishers about launching a media library service similar to Netflix Inc for tablets and other digital books, The Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday., * Amazon's media library similar to Netflix model -report

Body: NEW YORK From squishy garbage-themed collectibles "The Trash Pack" to remote-controlled flying fish "Air Swimmers," Toys R Us  is carrying a larger assortment of exclusive toys to win holiday shoppers from the likes of Amazon.com  and Wal-Mart Stores ., * Expansion may boost revenue, pressure margins-analyst, * To spend more on TV advertising, offer more online deals,SAN FRANCISCO Former Kleiner Perkins partner Eric Feng says there's room for one more social network-- built around experiences, not people., SAN FRANCISCO, Sept 14 Former Kleiner Perkinspartner Eric Feng says there's room for one more socialnetwork-- built around experiences, not people.

Body: Netflix Inc cut its third-quarter forecast by 1 million U.S. subscribers, sending its shares down nearly 19 percent, as the company known for rapid growth expects more fallout from a price increase on its DVD service. |Â , * Shares end 19 pct lower (Adds comments by Netflix executive, adds analyst comments,updates share prices),NEW YORK Google Inc and authors and publishers groups have about nine more months to untangle their six-year-old legal dispute over plans to create the world's largest digital library, a federal judge said on Thursday., NEW YORK, Sept 15 Google Inc  andauthors and publishers groups have about nine more months tountangle their six-year-old legal dispute over plans to createthe world's largest digital library, a federal judge said onThursday., HAMBURG, Sept 15 Deutsche Post DHL plans to invest in its German parcel business as it banks onconsumers buying more goods online instead of inbricks-and-mortar stores.

Title: EBay builds new division to woo developers,EBay builds new division to woo developers
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Ebay Inc is building a new division to woo developers and attract more merchants as the company tries to emulate the success of Apple Inc's iOS platform in the e-commerce world.,  * E-commerce giant revives X.com from PayPal's early days

Body: NEW YORK Barnes & Noble Inc forecast sales of its Nook e-reader and e-books would more than double this fiscal year to $1.8 billion and said book sales would get a lift from the demise of rival Borders, sending its shares up 8 percent, * Sees FY loss 10-50 cts/share vs Street view loss 16 cts,HONG KONG eBay Inc  expects sales from greater China to grow 30-40 percent annually from about $4 billion in 2010, with the e-commerce giant seeking acquisition opportunities as part of efforts to expand its footprint in the fast-growing market.,HONG KONG eBay Inc expects sales from greater China to grow 30-40 percent annually from about $4 billion in 2010, with the e-commerce giant seeking acquisition opportunities as part of efforts to expand its footprint in the fast-growing market.,SAN FRANCISCO Start-up companies using "freemium" business models, including Dropbox, SurveyMonkey, Animoto and Eventbrite, are thriving as the cost of computing power and storage falls., SAN FRANCISCO, Aug 30 Start-up companies using"freemium" business models, including Dropbox, SurveyMonkey,Animoto and Eventbrite, are thriving as the cost of computingpower and storage falls.,SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc may sell as many as 5 million tablet computers in the fourth quarter, making the largest Internet retailer the top competitor to Apple Inc in this fast-growing niche of the consumer PC market, Forrester Research said on Monday.

Body: NEW YORK Commodity-related stocks drove Wall Street lower on Wednesday as stiff declines in energy and metals prices underscored investor concerns about global economic weakness and Europe's raging debt crisis. |Â ,NEW YORK Amazon.com Inc took the wraps off its long-awaited "Kindle Fire" on Wednesday, tacking on a mass market-friendly $199 price tag that poses a serious threat to the dominance of Apple Inc's two-year-old iPad. |Â , * Amazon shares rise, Barnes & Noble dives (Adds link to FACTBOX),Amazon.com Inc, the world's largest online retailer, is using bricks-and-mortar stores to help sell its new tablet computer., * Strategy contrasts with initial Kindle launch in 2007 (Adds comment from Staples),NEW YORK Amazon.com Inc's aggressive pricing on its Kindle devices leaves Barnes & Noble Inc little choice but to match the online retailer and update its own devices, even if that means more damage to the bookstore chain's bottom line., Sept 28 Amazon.com Inc , the world'slargest online retailer, is using bricks-and-mortar stores tohelp sell its new tablet computer., NEW YORK, Sept 28 Amazon.com Inc's aggressive pricing on its Kindle devices leaves Barnes & NobleInc  little choice but to match the online retailer andupdate its own devices, even if that means more damage to thebookstore chain's bottom line., * Materials companies' shares slump as commodities fall, (Refiles to widen distribution, with no changes to text)

Body: NEW YORK Stocks mostly rose in a volatile session on Thursday as stronger-than-expected economic data and German approval of a beefed-up euro-zone crisis fund relieved two of the worst fears hanging over the market. |Â , * Dow up 1.3 pct, S&P up 0.8 pct, Nasdaq down 0.4 pct, * Dow up 1.3 pct, S&P up 0.8 pct, Nasdaq down 0.4 pct, (Refiles to add dropped word 'percent' in fifth paragraph),BlackBerry maker Research In Motion brushed off suggestions on Thursday that it would discontinue production of its PlayBook computer tablet as "pure fiction" after an analyst said the company may be considering an exit from the market.,LOS ANGELES Netflix Inc  shares slumped 11 percent on Thursday as competitors made moves to attract more customers with alternative options for movie and television content., * Dow up 1.3 pct, S&P 500 up 0.9 pct, Nasdaq up 0.1 pct, * Analyst said RIM may have canceled PlayBook production (Adds RIM statement, share price, background), * Dow up 1.5 pct, S&P 500 up 1.1 pct, Nasdaq up 0.2 pct, Sept 29 An analyst said on Thursday thatBlackBerry maker Research In Motion   may havehalted production of its PlayBook tablet computer and canceledadditional tablet projects.

Title: Amazon placed to thrive in mild recession: Stifel
Body: Amazon.com Inc's  low cost model and steady growth rate will ensure that the online retail giant will do very well even if there is a mild recession in the United States, analysts at Stifel Nicolaus said, upgrading the company to "buy."

Body: BOSTON Oracle Corp  is preparing to expand its offerings in cloud computing, one of the fastest-growing areas of the technology sector, the company said on Wednesday ahead of a speech by Chief Executive Larry Ellison.,  BOSTON, Oct 5 Oracle Corp  is preparingto expand its offerings in cloud computing, one of thefastest-growing areas of the technology sector, the company saidon Wednesday ahead of a speech by Chief Executive Larry Ellison.,NEW DELHI India launched what it dubbed the world's cheapest tablet computer Wednesday, to be sold to students at the subsidized price of $35 and later in shops for about $60., NEW DELHI, Oct 5 India launched what it dubbedthe world's cheapest tablet computer on Wednesday, to be sold tostudents at the subsidised price of $35 and later in shops forabout $60., * Gator 'Swampy' lifts Disney game to top of Apple charts, NEW DELHI, Oct 5 India unwraps what has beendubbed the world's cheapest tablet computer on Wednesday, to besold to students at the subsidised price of $35 to expanddigital access in the Asian giant that lags peers such as Chinaand Brazil in connectivity.

Title: Disney moves in on Angry Birds with Swampy game,Disney moves in on Angry Birds with Swampy game,Cloud computing disappoints early adopters: survey,Cloud computing disappoints early adopters-survey
Body: LOS ANGELES/NEW YORK It's not surprising, perhaps, that a game based on a sewer-dwelling alligator named "Swampy" ranks as the top paid app for iPhones and iPads. What's surprising is that the game is a product of Walt Disney Co.,   * Gator 'Swampy' lifts Disney game to top of Apple charts,LONDON Few organizations have moved to cloud computing -- the delivery of computing as a service from remote centers -- and of those that have, many are disappointed with the results, a survey published on Tuesday found., LONDON, Oct 4 Few organisations have moved tocloud computing -- the delivery of computing as a service fromremote centres -- and of those that have, many are disappointedwith the results, a survey published on Tuesday found.

Body: The release date for a Steve Jobs biography has been pushed up to October 24 in the wake of the Apple co-founder's death on Wednesday, according to a spokesman for publishing house Simon & Schuster.,The release date for a Steve Jobs biography has been pushed up to October 24, according to a spokesman for Simon & Schuster, the publishing house behind the long-awaited book., Oct 6 The release date for a Steve Jobsbiography has been pushed up to Oct. 24, according to aspokesman for Simon & Schuster, the publishing house behind thelong-awaited book.,Steve Jobs, Apple Inc's co-founder and former CEO who died Wednesday after a long battle with pancreatic cancer, created a series of seminal electronics products, reinvented several industries, and built Apple into a $350 billion juggernaut. |Â ,SEOUL The death of Apple's inspirational leader is likely to have a deep impact on the technology giant behind the iPod, iPhone and iPad, giving rivals a greater chance of catching up. |Â , * Jobs' death stirs worries about Apple's innovative streak, Oct 6 U.S. President Barack Obama was among themany people who paid tribute to Steve Jobs, calling the Appleco-founder a visionary and great American innovator., 6 ottobre Steve Jobs, co-fondatore ed ex AD diApple morto ieri dopo una lunga battaglia con un cancroal pancreas, ha creato  una serie di prodotti tecnologici,reinventato diverse societÃ  e fatto di Apple un gigante da 350miliardi di dollari.,   Oct. 5 Steve Jobs, Apple Inc's co-founder and former CEO who died Wednesday after a longbattle with pancreatic cancer, created a series of seminalelectronics products, reinvented several industries, and builtApple into a $350 billion juggernaut.,SAN FRANCISCO Technology giant Oracle Corp has developed an ambitious array of cloud computing services in a bid to catch up with Amazon.com Inc and Salesforce.com Inc, two leaders in the field.

Thewell is onshore.

Title: Microsoft buys Nook stake, Barnes & Noble shares soar
Body: NEW YORK/SEATTLE Microsoft Corp is jumping into the fast-growing e-books market by investing $605 million over five years in Barnes & Noble Inc's Nook e-reader and college business, as it looks to unlock Amazon.com and Apple Inc's grip on the exploding tablet computer market. |Â

Title: Amazon's streak of Fire ignites shares,UPDATE 5-Amazon's streak of Fire ignites shares,Housing, profits lift Wall Street, Amazon up late,US STOCKS-Housing, profits lift Wall St, Amazon up late,Instant View: Amazon trounces Street targets, shares soar,Amazon reports $13.2 bln in first-quarter revenue,After Apple, Amazon, too, may be in for wild ride,UPDATE 2-After Apple, Amazon, too, may be in for wild ride,After Apple, Amazon, too, may be in for wild ride
Body: Amazon.com Inc's quarterly results beat Wall Street's most bullish expectations as heavy spending by the world's largest Internet retailer began to pay off through sales of more digital products on its new Kindle Fire tablet.,* Kindle Fire spurs purchases of digital goods    * Margins improve as newer businesses grow faster    * Shares leap almost 15 pct    * Stake of CEO Bezos worth nearly $2.5 bln more    By Alistair Barr	    April 26 Amazon.com Inc's quarterlyresults beat Wall Street's most bullish expectations as heavyspending by the world's largest Internet retailer began to payoff through sales of more digital products on its new KindleFire tablet.	    Amazon shares surged almost 15 perc,NEW YORK U.S. stocks rose for a third day on Thursday after upbeat housing data and stronger-than-expected results from companies, including Citrix Systems Inc , overshadowed some high-profile earnings misses. |Â ,NEW YORK, April 26 U.S. stocks rose for a thirdday on Thursday after upbeat housing data andstronger-than-expected results from companies, including CitrixSystems Inc, overshadowed some high-profile earningsmisses.,Amazon.com Inc reported quarterly earnings that beat Wall Street's most bullish expectations after the world's largest Internet retailer brought costs under control, sending its shares almost 10 percent higher.,April 26 Amazon.com Inc reportedfirst-quarter revenue of $13.18 billion on Thursday, up 34percent from a year earlier and ahead of Wall Street estimates.,Analysts may be optimistic about Amazon.com's growth prospects, but with this week's blowout earnings from Apple and Amazon's own lofty share price to live up to, some traders are starting to hedge their bets.,April 26 Analysts may be optimistic aboutAmazon.com's growth prospects, but with this week's blowoutearnings from Apple and Amazon's own lofty share price to liveup to, some traders are starting to hedge their bets.,NEW YORK, April 26 Analysts may be optimisticabout Amazon.com's growth prospects, but with this week'sblowout earnings from Apple, and Amazon's own lofty share priceto live up to, some traders are starting to hedge their bets.

Body: Amazon.com agreed to begin collecting sales tax in Texas on Friday, forging a deal that promises to bring more jobs to the southern U.S. state and as the online marketer lost another round in a series of state-by-state sales tax battles.,April 27 Amazon.com agreed to begincollecting sales tax in Texas on Friday, forging a deal thatpromises to bring more jobs to the southern U.S. state and asthe online marketer lost another round in a series ofstate-by-state sales tax battles.,NEW YORK, April 27 U.S. stocks advanced onFriday and posted their best weekly gains in a month asstronger-than-expected earnings from Amazon.com Inc andExpedia Inc reinforced confidence in corporateperformance.,SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc's stellar quarterly results are helping convince skeptics on Wall Street that a bout of intense spending is beginning to pay off for an Internet retailer trying to transform itself into a technology company.,Amazon.com Inc reported quarterly earnings that beat Wall Street's most bullish expectations after the world's largest Internet retailer brought costs under control, sending its shares almost 10 percent higher.,NEW YORK, April 27 U.S. stocks advanced for afourth day on Friday, led by gains in technology afterstronger-than-expected earnings from Amazon.com Inc andExpedia Inc offset a weaker-than-expected reading oneconomic growth.,Amazon.com Inc's stellar quarterly results are helping convince skeptics on Wall Street that a bout of intense spending is beginning to pay off for an Internet retailer trying to transform itself into a technology company.,NEW YORK, April 27 U.S. stocks rose modestly onFriday, putting equities on track for a fourth day of gains asmore strong earnings partially offset a weaker-than-expectedreading on economic growth.

Title: Amazon, Google lead rush for new Web real estate
Body: LONDON An unprecedented land grab for new Web addresses began in earnest on Wednesday with fierce competition for new internet real estate including .app, .blog and .web from applicants hoping to break the near-monopoly of the .com top-level domain.

Title: Barnes & Noble says e-books settlement hurts public
Body: Barnes & Noble Inc  has objected to the U.S. government's proposed settlement of its price-fixing lawsuit against top publishers, saying it would harm book sellers and "millions and millions" of book buyers.

Title: Amazon's LoveFilm, taking on Netflix, adds Fox in Britain
Body: LoveFilm, Amazon's European DVD and movie streaming service, has agreed to stream movies and TV shows from News Corp's Twentieth Century Fox TV unit, adding content from another Hollywood studio to compete with Netflix's six-month-old British service.

Title: Freescale shares fall on weak sales outlook
Body: Shares of Freescale Semiconductor Holdings Ltd  fell nearly 12 percent in early trade after the chipmaker forecast third-quarter revenue below expectations and several brokerages cut their price target on the stock.

Title: Special Report: Brazil backslides on protecting the Amazon
Body: ITAITUBA, Brazil Ivo Lubrinna has been wildcatting for gold in the jungle here for more than 30 years. It's a notoriously messy business, as crews strip away topsoil in the forest and along riverbanks and use mercury and other pollutants to draw precious metal from mud.

Title: EBay shares gain on strong July sales data

Title: Brazil's Belo Monte dam risks delay after court order,Brazil's Belo Monte dam risks delay after court order

Title: Venezuela investigates alleged massacre in Amazon tribal village,Venezuela investigates alleged massacre in Amazon tribal village

Body: Internet sales jumped more than 30 percent on Cyber Monday, making it the biggest online shopping day ever, according to data released on Tuesday.,* Cyber Monday sales up 30.3 percent over 2011 - IBM    * Amazon says its Kindle devices had biggest sales day ever    * ChannelAdvisor says client sales growth stronger on eBaythan Amazon    By Alistair Barr    Nov 27 Internet sales jumped more than 30percent on Cyber Monday, making it the biggest online shoppingday ever, according to data released on Tuesday.      Walmart.com, the online division of Walmart U.S., had itsbest sales day in history, a spokeswoman said.    ,BRASILIA, Nov 27 Brazil has something to tout atglobal climate change talks that began this week in Doha:destruction of the world's largest rainforest is still slowingat a record pace.,SAN FRANCISCO ChannelAdvisor said on Tuesday that client sales on eBay Inc's online marketplace grew faster than on Amazon.com Inc's website during the crucial first five days of the holiday shopping season.,SAN FRANCISCO, Nov 27 ChannelAdvisor said onTuesday that client sales on eBay Inc's onlinemarketplace grew faster than on Amazon.com Inc's website during the crucial first five days of the holidayshopping season.,Nov 27 Cyber Monday was the biggest day ever forsales of Amazon.com Inc's Kindle electronic devices,the online retail giant said on Tuesday, without saying how manyit actually sold.    On Monday, Nov. 26, when retailers offered big deals onlinefor "Cyber Monday," Amazon.com cut the price of the Kindle Firetablet by $30 to $129 and it was the biggest Cyber Monday dealever for Amazon.com, the company said.    Nine of the top 10 best-selling products on Amazon.com sinceit unvei

Body: SAN BRUNO, California Wal-Mart Stores Inc is ramping up plans to combine its physical stores with online technology, testing the use of lockers to hold goods ordered on the Internet until shoppers pick them up, as the world's largest retailer tries to catch up with e-commerce leader Amazon.com Inc.,SAN BRUNO, Calif., March 26 Wal-Mart Stores Inc is ramping up plans to combine its physical stores withonline technology, testing the use of lockers to hold goodsordered on the Internet until shoppers pick them up, as theworld's largest retailer tries to catch up with e-commerceleader Amazon.com Inc.,LIMA, March 26 Decades of oil spills in a swathof Peru's Amazon jungle have spoiled the environment and it mustbe urgently cleaned up by the energy company Pluspetrol toprotect public health, Environment Minister Manuel Pulgar-Vidalsaid.

Title: UPDATE 4-Wal-Mart steps up its online game with help from stores
Body: SAN BRUNO, Calif., March 26 Wal-Mart Stores Inc, facing growing competition for quick delivery ofphysical goods from online retailers like Amazon.com Inc, said on Tuesday it would start using its stores to getInternet orders to customers faster.

Title: "Ding Dong! The Witch Is Dead" hits UK chart on Thatcher's death
Body: LONDON The death of former British Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher has sent a 74-year-old song, "Ding Dong! The Witch Is Dead", flying into the UK charts, figures showed on Wednesday.

Title: Senate shows support for states taxing online sales,Senate shows support for U.S. states taxing online sales

Title: Brazil may fine beef producers buying Amazon cattle
Body: BRASILIA, April 15 Brazilian prosecutors areseeking to fine 26 beef producers a total of $282 million forbuying cattle raised in illegally deforested Amazon areas or onindigenous reservations, the federal prosecution service said onMonday.

hikes in its biggest unit.    IP, which makes shipping boxes as well as boxes for consumergoods such as medicines and cigarettes, said it expected resultswould only improve later this year as it becomes more efficientand takes market share.    "Even in a ,International Paper Co , the largest provider of shipping boxes for Amazon.com Inc  and other giant e-commerce companies, said Thursday Title: Amazon founder Bezos to buy the Washington Post,Factbox: A look inside the Washington Post Co businesses,Timeline: Notable events in Washington Post history,Graham, Bezos hashed out Washington Post deal in Sun Valley,UPDATE 3-Amazon founder Bezos to buy the Washington Post
Body: Amazon.com Inc founder Jeff Bezos will buy the Washington Post newspaper for $250 million in a surprise deal that ends the Graham family's 80-year ownership and hands one of the country's most influential publications to the tech entrepreneur. |Â ,NEW YORK Amazon.com Inc. founder Jeff Bezos announced Monday that he had agreed to purchase the Washington Post newspaper and some other papers owned by the Washington Post Co for $250 million. The education and media company's flagship daily is only a small part of its operations:,NEW YORK Amazon.com Inc founder Jeff Bezos announced on Monday that he has agreed to buy the newspapers owned by The Washington Post Co for $250 million. Here are some notable events in the history of the company since the founding of its flagship daily in 1877:,Donald Graham, the chairman and CEO of The Washington Post Co, started talking to Amazon.com's Jeff Bezos less than a month before cinching a $250 million deal to sell the flagship newspaper to the tech entrepreneur.,Aug 5 Amazon.com Inc founder Jeff Bezoswill buy the Washington Post newspaper for $250 million in asurprise deal that ends the Graham family's 80-year ownershipand hands one of the country's most influential publications tothe tech entrepreneur.

Body: When journalists pressed William Henry Vanderbilt in 1882 about his plan to discontinue his railroad's popular but unprofitable mail run, the richest man in the world reportedly exclaimed, "The public be damned!" Whether Vanderbilt said "be damned" or not â€” he claimed to have been misquoted â€” business titans of the Gilded Age routinely assumed this default posture.,NEW YORK Amazon.com, the website of the world's largest online retailer, went down for about 15 minutes on Monday in a rare outage for many users across the United States and Canada.,NEW YORK, Aug 19 Amazon.com, thewebsite of the world's largest online retailer, went down onMonday for many users across the United States and Canada.

Body: CHICAGO As an Amazon Prime customer since December 2012, Michelle Huffman of Milwaukee has gladly paid the annual $79 fee for the perk of free two-day shipping on items ranging from tea and cookbooks to DVDs and Nestle Smarties (milk chocolate buttons imported from Germany).,(Changes references to Randy Allen below the sub-heading'REVOLT' to "her" from "his" and to "Allen" from "he."),NEW YORK, Feb 26 Apple Inc urged a U.S.appeals court to throw out a judge's "radical" finding that itviolated antitrust law by manipulating electronic book prices,and blamed publishers for running a conspiracy it claimed toknow nothing about.

Title: UPDATE 3-Better profit at Best Buy in holiday quarter cheers investors
Body: Feb 27 U.S. retailer Best Buy Co Inc reported a better-than-expected profit in the quarter coveringthe holiday season and said it would more aggressively cut coststhis year to fund its turnaround efforts, sending shares higherin midday trading.

Title: U.S. Supreme Court agrees to hear Amazon workers' security check case,U.S. Supreme Court agrees to hear Amazon workers' security check case
Body: The U.S. Supreme Court agreed on Monday to hear a case that could determine whether companies such as Amazon.com Inc  must pay workers for the time they spend waiting to clear security checks at the end of their work shifts.,March 3 The U.S. Supreme Court agreed on Mondayto hear a case that could determine whether companies such asAmazon.com Inc must pay workers for the time they spendwaiting to clear security checks at the end of their workshifts.

Title: Germany's Otto invests to see off Amazon, Zalando threat
Body: BERLIN, March 6 Germany's Otto,Europe's second biggest e-commerce player, is investing in itsmobile platform and plans to launch a new fashion website as itfights to keep pace with the rapid expansion of Amazon.

Title: Outlook for online state sales tax fix dims in U.S. Congress
Body: WASHINGTON, March 12 Prospects for federalaction to resolve a fight over state sales taxation of onlineretailing faded on Wednesday in the U.S. Congress, after asenior Republican lawmaker said more debate is needed beforelegislation can move forward.

Title: Czech city deals blow to Amazon's plans for distribution hub
Body: PRAGUE, March 18 The Czech Republic'ssecond-largest city Brno dealt a blow to U.S. online retailerAmazon.com Inc's plans for a distribution centre in thesouth of the country, as councillors  voted on Tuesday to rejectsome conditions for its construction.

Title: Shifts in rainfall, not warming pause, slow sea level rise,Shifts in rainfall, not warming pause, slow sea level rise
Body: OSLO Heavy rains from the Amazon to Australia have curbed sea level rise so far this century by shifting water from the oceans to land, according to a study that rejects theories that the slowdown is tied to a pause in global warming.,* Underlying rate of sea level rise continues - French study

Title: Amazon closes third-party store in China over fake cosmetic report,Amazon closes third-party store in China over fake cosmetic report
Body: SHANGHAI U.S. e-commerce giant Amazon.com Inc's China unit will strengthen regulation of its online sales channels and has closed down a third-party store, the online retailer said on Thursday, after state media criticized Amazon and smaller local rival Dangdang for selling fake cosmetics.,SHANGHAI, March 21 U.S e-commerce giantAmazon.com Inc's China unit will strengthen regulationof its online sales channels and has closed down a third-partystore, the online retailer said on Thursday, after state mediacriticised Amazon and smaller local rival Dangdang for sellingfake cosmetics.

Body: NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO Amazon.com Inc made a play for the increasingly crowded home entertainment arena by unveiling the $99 "Fire TV" video and game streaming device on Wednesday, with hopes of boosting its main online retail business over the longer term. |Â ,NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO, April 2 Amazon.com Inc made a play for the increasingly crowded homeentertainment arena by unveiling the $99 "Fire TV" video andgame streaming device on Wednesday, with hopes of boosting itsmain online retail business over the longer term.,SAN FRANCISCO, April 2 Apple Inc,Google Inc and Facebook Inc have madesignificant progress in adopting renewable energy sources topower their Web services, the environmental group Greenpeacesaid in a report on Wednesday.,NEW YORK/SAN FRANCISCO, April 2 Amazon.com Inc unveiled a video streaming device dubbed Fire TV onWednesday that can pipe video directly to television and offersa more prominent showcase for the e-commerce giant's slate oforiginal programming.,PRAGUE, April 2 Amazon.com has droppeda plan to build a logistics centre in the eastern Czech city ofBrno following a decision by local authorities not to endorsethe project, a spokeswoman said on Wednesday.

Title: RPT-Amazon's tax-free European profits drop after IRS clamp-down

Title: China has more people going online with a mobile device than a PC
Body: BEIJING, July 21 The number of China's internetusers going online with a mobile device - such as a smartphoneor tablet - has overtaken those doing so with a personalcomputer (PC) for the first time, said the official ChinaInternet Network Information Center (CNNIC) on Monday.

Title: Amazon to invest $2 billion more in India as e-commerce race heats up,REFILE-UPDATE 1-Amazon to invest $2 bln more in India as e-commerce race heats up,Amazon says to invest $2 billion more in India
Body: MUMBAI Amazon.com Inc  on Wednesday said it will invest a further $2 billion in India just a day after the country's largest e-tailer Flipkart attracted $1 billion of fresh funds, raising the stakes in a nascent but fast-growing e-commerce sector.,* Announcement follows rival Flipkart $1 bln fund raising,July 30 Amazon.com Inc will invest anadded $2 billion in India as the e-commerce giant ramps upbusiness in the country, the company said on Wednesday, a dayafter local rival Flipkart announced a fresh round of fundingworth $1 billion.

Title: Amazon stops some Disney movie preorders: WSJ
Body: NEW YORK Amazon.com has halted pre-orders of some Disney movies, the Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday, in what appears to be another contract dispute after the online giant began a protracted spat with publisher Hachette Book Group this year.

Title: Amazon stops some Disney movie preorders: WSJ
Body: NEW YORK Amazon.com Inc has halted pre-orders of some Disney movies, the Wall Street Journal reported, in what appears to be another contract dispute after the online retailer began a protracted spat with publisher Hachette Book Group this year. |Â

Title: Brazil makes progress on saving forests, Indonesia risks setbacks-report,Brazil makes progress on saving forests, Indonesia risks setbacks-report
Body: OSLO Brazil has made good progress in safeguarding the Amazon rainforest but Indonesia's plans for its forests could face setbacks under a new government, a report commissioned by top forest aid donor Norway said on Monday.,OSLO, Aug 18 Brazil has made good progress insafeguarding the Amazon rainforest but Indonesia's plans for itsforests could face setbacks under a new government, a reportcommissioned by top forest aid donor Norway said on Monday.

Title: Conservation of Amazon threatened by poor social conditions of its people: study
Body: LONDON (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - The conservation of Brazil's Amazon is threatened by the poor social conditions of its 24 million inhabitants, the first comprehensive study measuring the situation found on Saturday.

Title: Amazon CFO to step down next summer amid investor discontent,UPDATE 2-Amazon CFO to step down next summer amid investor discontent
Body: Amazon.com Inc's finance chief plans to step down next summer after more than a dozen years at the post, the e-commerce company said on Wednesday, at a time when more investors have been complaining about skimpy profits and high spending.,Sept 3 Amazon.com Inc's finance chiefplans to step down next summer after more than a dozen years atthe post, the e-commerce company said on Wednesday, at a timewhen more investors have been complaining about skimpy profitsand high spending.

Title: Washington Post names ex-Politico executive as publisher
Body: WASHINGTON, Sept 2 The Washington Post's owner,Amazon.com Inc founder Jeff Bezos, has named a formerexecutive from rival Politico as publisher of the 137-year-oldnewspaper, replacing Katharine Weymouth.

Title: Isolated Peruvian tribe risks human contact, and disease
Body: ALTO MADRE DE DIOS RIVER Peru Six Mashco Piro tribeswomen crouched low as they escaped back into the jungle after raiding a remote lodge in Peru's Manu National Park in the western Amazon, clutching newly prized tools: metallic cooking pots.

Title: No quick fix in U.S. bid to end reliance on Russian rocket engines,No quick fix in U.S. bid to end reliance on Russian rocket engines
Body: WASHINGTON The U.S. drive to end its reliance on Russian rocket motors got a boost this week when Amazon.com Inc founder Jeff Bezos unveiled a new engine project, but officials and industry insiders say it will take years and hundreds of millions of dollars to develop a locally built alternative.,WASHINGTON, Sept 21 The U.S. drive to end itsreliance on Russian rocket motors got a boost this week whenAmazon.com Inc founder Jeff Bezos unveiled a new engineproject, but officials and industry insiders say it will takeyears and hundreds of millions of dollars to develop a locallybuilt alternative.

Title: Verizon's Redbox Instant video streaming service to shut down
Body: NEW YORK, Oct 4 Redbox Instant, a streamingvideo service operated by Verizon Communications Inc andOuterwall Inc's Redbox, will shut down next weekbecause the venture has not been as successful as hoped, the twocompanies announced Saturday.

Title: Will in-store pick-up of online sales pay off for retailers?

But the tactic couldraise costs - and create problems managing inventory, retailanalysts and consultants said.

Title: Seattle police find no explosives after Amazon HQ threat
Body: SEATTLE Seattle police searched for explosives at Amazon.com's headquarters after a threatening letter was found at a company building just north of the city's downtown district, but found nothing, authorities said on Monday.

Title: Stores fight back as Christmas delivery delays hit e-tailers
Body: BERLIN/PARIS, Dec 18 The Christmas rush isexposing the limitations of internet-only retailers as surgingorders cause delivery delays, allowing Europe's shops to fightback with "click and collect" services and more in-storetheatre.

Title: Flipkart raises $700 million in fresh funding,Flipkart raises $700 million in fresh funding

Title: Exclusive-Survey: Trouble for Amazon Prime's two-day deliveries?
Body: SAN FRANCISCO/CHICAGO Amazon.com Inc packages ordered by its Prime members regularly arrived late over the holidays, a Reuters/Ipsos survey shows, reflecting the strain on the logistics network that transformed the company into an e-commerce powerhouse.

Title: Amazon.com expands into professional services with home marketplace
Body: CHICAGO, March 30 Amazon.com Inc islaunching a home services marketplace that will connectcustomers with electricians, plumbers and painters in a move tohave its services tied to every product sold on its website.

Title: Alibaba-backed ShopRunner gains momentum, eyes China
Body: SAN MATEO, Calif. ShopRunner Inc, the e-commerce startup backed by Alibaba Group Holding Ltd that styles itself in some ways as the anti-Amazon, more than doubled its users over the past year and hopes to do so again in 2015, Shoprunner's chief executive said in an interview.

Title: Netflix to premiere original series "Montauk" in 2016
Body: April 2 Streaming video service provider NetflixInc said it will premiere its next series, "Montauk",in 2016 as it looks to boost its original content in a highlycompetitive market.

Title: Amazon's Prime Day draws big virtual crowd, frustrates some shoppers
Body: Merchants participating in Amazon.com's much-advertised "Prime Day" sale saw an 80 percent rise in U.S. sales from a year earlier, according to preliminary data from e-commerce researcher ChannelAdvisor, although the event also drew ire from some shoppers.

Title: Wal-Mart takes on Amazon's 'Prime Day' with online sale,Peru delays bids for country's most productive oil block,Wal-Mart takes on Amazon's "Prime Day" with online sale

Title: Macy's to expand same-day delivery to new U.S. markets, challenging Amazon,Amazon expands home services marketplace in U.S. cities,UPDATE 1-Amazon expands home services marketplace in U.S. cities,Macy's to expand same-day delivery to new U.S. markets, challenging Amazon,Amazon expands local services marketplace in U.S. cities
Body: CHICAGO/SAN FRANCISCO Macy's Inc  is expanding same-day delivery to several new U.S. markets this summer, one of the most aggressive pushes by a brick-and-mortar retailer in an area dominated by e-commerce giant Amazon , according to a Macy's official. |Â ,SEATTLE Amazon.com Inc  said on Wednesday it would expand a marketplace that offers home services from plumbing to fence repairs in 15 U.S. cities and help customers find contractors for more expensive home projects as it develops its role as a middle man for third-party vendors. Â Â Â The e-commerce company said it now offers more than 15 million unique services through its home services marketplace, up from 2 million when it launched in March.,SEATTLE, July 22 Amazon.com Inc said onWednesday it would expand a marketplace that offers homeservices from plumbing to fence repairs in 15 U.S. cities andhelp customers find contractors for more expensive home projectsas it develops its role as a middle man for third-party vendors.,CHICAGO/SAN FRANCISCO, July 22 Macy's Inc is expanding same-day delivery to several new U.S. markets thissummer, one of the most aggressive pushes by a brick-and-mortarretailer in an area dominated by e-commerce giant Amazon, according to a Macy's official.,SEATTLE, July 22 Amazon said onWednesday it would expand a marketplace that offers servicesfrom plumbing to fence repairs in 15 cities and help customersfind contractors for more expensive home projects as it developsits role as a middleman for third-party vendors.

Title: Amazon posts anomalous profit, Wall Street swoons,Analysis: Amazon posts anomalous profit, Wall Street swoons
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Investor enthusiasm for Amazon.com Inc  is pretty consistent: the stock tends to rise, even though the company isn't consistent about making profits.,SAN FRANCISCO Investor enthusiasm for Amazon.com Inc is pretty consistent: the stock tends to rise, even though the company isn't consistent about making profits.

Title: Amazon partners with startups to sell crowdfunded products
Body: SAN FRANCISCO, July 28 Amazon.com Inc launched a new platform on Tuesday that will help startupsadvertise and distribute their products directly to millions ofAmazon customers, filling an important gap for entrepreneurstrying to reach a wider market of consumers.

Title: Alibaba cloud unit sets sights on Amazon in $1 billion global push,CORRECTED-Alibaba cloud unit sets sights on Amazon in $1 billion global push
Body: BEIJING China's Alibaba Group Holding Ltd  said on Wednesday it would invest $1 billion into its Aliyun cloud computing arm to challenge Amazon.com Inc's  lucrative Web Services division, opening a global front in the battle between the two e-commerce giants.,BEIJING, July 29 China's Alibaba Group HoldingLtd said on Wednesday it would invest $1 billion intoits Aliyun cloud computing arm to challenge Amazon.com Inc's lucrative Web Services division, opening a global frontin the battle between the two e-commerce giants.

Body: NEW YORK Amazon.com founder and Chief Executive Officer Jeff Bezos got a lot richer while he slept on Thursday night, after the company reported its quarterly earnings and its shares rose 20.1 percent.,Amazon.com Inc's shares surged more than 20 percent in early trading on Friday, adding more than $46 billion to the company's market value, after strong growth in the e-commerce giant's cloud business drove a surprise quarterly profit. |Â ,The S&P 500 and Nasdaq posted their largest weekly drops since March on Friday as slowing global growth dragged commodity-related stocks lower while an earnings-fueled drop in Biogen took down the biotech sector.,* Indexes down: Dow 0.9 pct, S&P 1.1 pct, Nasdaq 1.1 pct (Updates to close),NEW YORK, July 24 Amazon.com founder and ChiefExecutive Officer Jeff Bezos got a lot richer while he slept onThursday night, after the company reported its quarterlyearnings and its shares rose 20.1 percent.,Amazon's stock price surge into Friday made it the latest of a series of companies to boom following results, and its performance this year, along with a few others, has basically kept the S&P 500 above water.,NEW YORK, July 24 Amazon.com founder and ChiefExecutive Officer Jeff Bezos got a lot richer while he slept onThursday night, after the company reported its quarterlyearnings and its shares rose 20.1 percent.,* Amazon jumps to record high after posting unexpectedprofit,* Amazon jumps to record high after posting unexpectedprofit,July 24 Amazon.com Inc's shares surgedmore than 20 percent in early trading on Friday, adding morethan $46 billion to the company's market value, after stronggrowth in the e-commerce giant's cloud business drove a surprisequarterly profit.

Title: Growth of ecommerce pushes funds into small-fry shipping firms,Internet firms to be subject to new cybersecurity rules in EU,Internet firms to be subject to new cybersecurity rules in EU,Internet firms to be subject to new cybersecurity rules in EU
Body: NEW YORK Forget Amazon and its out-of-this-world share price.,Internet firms such as Cisco, Google and Amazon will be subject to a new EUcybersecurity law forcing them to adopt tough security measuresand possibly report serious breaches to national authorities,according to a document seen by Reuters.,BRUSSELS Internet firms such as Cisco , Google  and Amazon  will be subject to a new EU cybersecurity law forcing them to adopt tough security measures and possibly report serious breaches to national authorities, according to a document seen by Reuters.,BRUSSELS, Aug 6 Internet firms such as Cisco, Google and Amazon will be subjectto a new EU cybersecurity law forcing them to adopt toughsecurity measures and possibly report serious breaches tonational authorities, according to a document seen by Reuters.

Title: UPDATE 2-Vale halts Amazon nickel mine output after court order
Body: RIO DE JANEIRO, Aug 14 Vale SA stoppedoperations at its OnÃ§a Puma nickel mine in Brazil's Amazon aftera Brazilian federal court on Friday ordered the halt because ofdisputed payments to indigenous communities.

Title: LG Display to focus investment on OLED in next-generation push
Body: SEOUL, Aug 17 South Korea's LG Display Co Ltd said on Monday it would focus investment on organiclight-emitting diode (OLED) displays, betting on thenext-generation technology to steer it clear of price wars andahead of the competition.

Body: * Shares fall as much as 16.6 pct (Repeats to fix formatting with no changes to text),WASHINGTON Aerojet Rocketdyne Holdings Inc  submitted a $2 cash billion offer to buy United Launch Alliance (ULA), a satellite launch provider jointly held by Lockheed Martin Corp  and Boeing Co , sources familiar with the matter said Tuesday, a deal that would further consolidate the space business.,WASHINGTON, Sept 8 Aerojet Rocketdyne HoldingsInc submitted a $2 cash billion offer to buy UnitedLaunch Alliance (ULA), a satellite launch provider jointly heldby Lockheed Martin Corp and Boeing Co, sourcesfamiliar with the matter said Tuesday, a deal that would furtherconsolidate the space business.

Title: In North Korea, deals on the bus make markets go round,In North Korea, deals on the bus make markets go round,Lockheed-Boeing rocket venture expands partnership with Bezos' space firm

Title: UPDATE 1-Oculus and Samsung unveil new Gear VR for $99
